solution.text:
The impression of an image persists at the retina for \(\frac1{16}^{th}\) of a second.
Hence, the images of a still object must be flashed on the eye at a rate faster than 16 per second.

content.text: If still images of a moving object are flashed on the eye at a rate of _{j}_ per second, then the eye perceives this object as moving.
